title: Buckingham Society Tea
hero_caption: Paul Cezanne. Auvers, Panoramic View (detail), 1873–75. The Art Institute of Chicago, Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Larned Coburn Memorial Collection.
short_description: Join fellow members of the Buckingham Society on May 12 for coffee and a sweet treat following the member lecture led by curators Gloria Groom and Caitlin Haskell, along with an exclusive member preview of the exhibition.  Support from Buckingham Society members like you helps ensure visitors of all ages and backgrounds have access to everything the museum offers—thank you.
list_description: Join fellow members of the Buckingham Society on May 12 for coffee and a sweet treat following the member lecture led by curators Gloria Groom and Caitlin Haskell, along with an exclusive member preview of the exhibition.
description:
Join fellow members of the Buckingham Society on May 12 for coffee and a sweet treat following an exclusive preview of the groundbreaking retrospective Cezanne and a member lecture on the exhibition led by curators Gloria Groom and Caitlin Haskell.

In the Art Institute’s early days, the Buckingham family played a critical role in ensuring the museum’s future. The Buckingham siblings—Clarence, Lucy Maud, and Kate Sturgis—each supported the museum in their own way: Clarence gifted his 2,500 Japanese prints in 1914, and Lucy Maud and Kate donated artworks and established endowments to support the collection’s growth and care. Since then, many more individuals have provided for the museum’s continued strength and excellence with bequests of all sizes. 

Support from Buckingham Society members helps ensure visitors of all ages and backgrounds have access to everything the museum offers. To learn more about becoming a member of the Buckingham Society, please reach out to:

Mary DeYoe
Associate Director, Philanthropy
(312) 443-3522
mdeyoe@artic.edu

To ensure a safe experience, all guests must follow the visiting policies in place at the time of the event. If you feel unwell or are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms, we ask that you please stay home. We appreciate your cooperation and support!
location: Museum Café on the lower level
buy_button_caption: Free to members of the Buckingham Society
